title: Guide to yang7er
text: yang7er provides calculation difference state regional hpi, well graphing change state hpi, change regional hpi. house price index (HPI) measures price changes residential housing percentage change specific start date (HPI 100). built-data package comes Federal Housing Finance Agency, included HPI US states 1975 2018. vignette shows derive HPI difference state region, image state’s HPI change, image region’s change using yang7er package Load yang7er package using library() function.

title: Guide to yang7er
text: HPI Data Description HPI data sets needed blog comes Federal Housing Finance Agency, tabular data 26877 rows 9 columns data. details dataset can found using function help(hpi)

title: Guide to yang7er
text: want check build-data, can use:
code: get_hpi() #> Rows: 26877 Columns: 5 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> chr (1): state #> dbl (4): year, month, price_index, us_avg #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. #> Joining, by = "state" #> # A tibble: 26,877 × 9 #> # Groups:   year, region [220] #>     year month state price_index us_avg year_avg us_year_avg region      regio…¹ #>    <dbl> <dbl> <chr>       <dbl>  <dbl>    <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>         <dbl> #>  1  1975     1 AK           34.6   23.5     37.2        24.2 Pacific We…    26.4 #>  2  1975     2 AK           35.1   23.6     37.2        24.2 Pacific We…    26.4 #>  3  1975     3 AK           35.5   23.8     37.2        24.2 Pacific We…    26.4 #>  4  1975     4 AK           35.9   24.1     37.2        24.2 Pacific We…    26.4 #>  5  1975     5 AK           36.3   24.2     37.2        24.2 Pacific We…    26.4 #>  6  1975     6 AK           36.7   24.2     37.2        24.2 Pacific We…    26.4 #>  7  1975     7 AK           37.2   24.3     37.2        24.2 Pacific We…    26.4 #>  8  1975     8 AK           37.7   24.4     37.2        24.2 Pacific We…    26.4 #>  9  1975     9 AK           38.4   24.5     37.2        24.2 Pacific We…    26.4 #> 10  1975    10 AK           39.1   24.6     37.2        24.2 Pacific We…    26.4 #> # … with 26,867 more rows, and abbreviated variable name ¹​region_avg

title: Guide to yang7er
text: want get information Ak, 2006, can use:
code: diff_region_state("AK",2016) #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #> # Groups:   state, year [1] #>    year state region            region_avg state_avg  diff #>   <dbl> <chr> <chr>                  <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl> #> 1  2016 AK    Pacific West Area       184.      174.  9.83

what: Region and State HPI Difference — diff_region_state
title: Region and State HPI Difference — diff_region_state
text: Calculating difference hpi region state

title: Region and State HPI Difference — diff_region_state
Region and State HPI Difference — diff_region_state
text: State Character. state name hpi dataset, can choose unique(yang7er::hpi$state) Year Numeric. year 1975 2018, can choose unique(yang7er::hpi$year)

title: Region and State HPI Difference — diff_region_state
text: data.frame. information include: year : year chosen. state : state chosen. region : region chosen state belongs region avg : Region average HPI. state avg : State average HPI. diff : Region average HPI- State average HPI.

title: Region and State HPI Difference — diff_region_state
text: function using data 'hpi', calculating difference hpi region state. can put state name,  year, show tibble include year, state, region, region avg, state avg diff.

title: Region and State HPI Difference — diff_region_state
code: diff_region_state("AK",2018) #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #> # Groups:   state, year [1] #>    year state region            region_avg state_avg  diff #>   <dbl> <chr> <chr>                  <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl> #> 1  2018 AK    Pacific West Area       214.      179.  35.7

title: Get data HPI — get_hpi
text: function get HPI data

title: Get data HPI — get_hpi
text: data frame 26877 rows 9 variables: year:year month:month state:states US price_index:house price index us_avg:us annual average HPI year_avg:every stats's anaual average HPI us_year_avg:us annual average HPI region:state belongs region region_avg:every region's anaual average HPI

title: Get data HPI — get_hpi
text: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2019/2019-02-05/state_hpi.csv"

title: Get data HPI — get_hpi
text: dataset containing year,month,state,price_index,us_avg,year_avg,us_year_avg,region,region_avg

title: Get data HPI — get_hpi
code: get_hpi #> function ()  #> { #>     url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2019/2019-02-05/state_hpi.csv" #>     `%>%` <- magrittr::`%>%` #>     region1 <- c("WA", "OR", "CA", "NV", "AZ", "UT", "ID", "AK",  #>         "HI") %>% tibble::as_tibble() %>% dplyr::mutate(region = "Pacific West Area") #>     region2 <- c("MT", "WY", "CO", "NM", "TX", "KS", "OK", "NE",  #>         "SD", "ND") %>% tibble::as_tibble() %>% dplyr::mutate(region = "Plains Area") #>     region3 <- c("MN", "IA", "MO", "IL", "WI", "MI", "IN", "OH",  #>         "KY") %>% tibble::as_tibble() %>% dplyr::mutate(region = "Midwest Area") #>     region4 <- c("AR", "LA", "MS", "TN", "AL", "GA", "FL", "SC",  #>         "NC") %>% tibble::as_tibble() %>% dplyr::mutate(region = "Sourtheast Area") #>     region5 <- c("ME", "VT", "NH", "MA", "CT", "RI", "NY", "PA",  #>         "WV", "VA", "MD", "DE", "NJ", "DC") %>% tibble::as_tibble() %>%  #>         dplyr::mutate(region = "Northeast Area") #>     region <- region1 %>% rbind(region2, region3, region4, region5) %>%  #>         dplyr::rename(state = "value") #>     hpi <- readr::read_csv(url) %>% janitor::clean_names() %>%  #>         dplyr::group_by(year, state) %>% dplyr::mutate(year_avg = mean(price_index),  #>         us_year_avg = mean(us_avg)) %>% dplyr::left_join(region) %>%  #>         dplyr::group_by(year, region) %>% dplyr::mutate(region_avg = mean(price_index)) #>     rm(region1, region2, region3, region4, region5, region) #>     return(hpi) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x561aa7bd4b78> #> <environment: namespace:yang7er>

title: Run Shiny App — run_app
code: run_app #> function ()  #> { #>     shiny::runApp(appDir = system.file("myapp/app.R", package = "yang7er")) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x561aa83431a8> #> <environment: namespace:yang7er>
